jgame.controller

Class AbstractLocRotController

  • java.lang.Object
    • jgame.controller.AbstractLocRotController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Controller
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    KeyboardLocationController, MouseLocationController, PointOrbitController, PolygonController

    public abstract class AbstractLocRotController
extends java.lang.Object
implements Controller
    An abstract controller that allows both movement and rotation to follow the path tangent as a moving average. Subclasses need only define the desired displacement, and this class will handle the rest of the movement.
    Author:
    William Chargin

    • Field Detail

      • maxSpeed

        private double maxSpeed
        The maximum speed. A value of -1 indicates unbounded speed.

      • rotateToFollow

        private boolean rotateToFollow
        Whether to rotate the object to follow the cursor.

      • rotationOffset

        private double rotationOffset
        The rotation offset. This has no effect if rotateToFollow is disabled.

      • previousTransforms

        private java.util.List<java.awt.geom.Point2D> previousTransforms
        The list of previous transforms.

      • movingAverageCount

        private int movingAverageCount
        The count for moving averages of the rotation transform. A maximum of this many previous transformations will be averaged to find the proper rotation. This ensures a smooth transition of rotations. The larger this number, the smoother the transition, but also the longer it will take. A value of around 15 (assuming a frame rate of 30 fps) is recommended. This class uses a simple (unweighted) moving average.

        For more information, consider reading the Wikipedia article on moving averages.

        Creates the controller with the specified rotation settings.
        Parameters:
        rotateToFollow - whether the controller should rotate the object to follow the path
        rotationOffset - the rotation offset (default is 0)

    • Method Detail

      • calculateControl

        protected abstract java.awt.geom.Point2D calculateControl(GObject target,
                                                          Context context)
        Calculates the required control the given object with the given context. This method will only be invoked after an immediately preceding call to canControl(GObject, Context) with the same parameters, and only if said method call returns true.
        Parameters:
        target - the object to control
        context - the context
        Returns:
        a point representing the displacement as a result of the transform in the form new Point(dx, dy), where dx is the displacement in the positive x direction and dy is the displacement in the positive y direction

      • canControl

        protected abstract boolean canControl(GObject target,
                                      Context context)
        Determines whether the given target can be controlled in the given context.
        Parameters:
        target - the target
        context - the context
        Returns:
        true if the target can be controlled, or false if it cannot

      • setRotationOffset

        public void setRotationOffset(double rotationOffset)
        Sets the offset for the rotation. This method will have no effect if rotateToFollow is disabled; you can enable it with setRotateToFollow(true).
        Parameters:
        rotationOffset - the new offset
